I'll take it back, x.sort(True) should fail in any case.
Having descending as kwargs_only: True in case dim is not provided is the way to go.

This allows the following to be valid on both a Tensor and a Variable:

x.sort(0)
x.sort(dim=0)
x.sort(descending=True)
x.sort(dim=0, descending=True)
x.sort(0, descending=True)
x.sort(0,True)

and

x.sort(True)
x.sort(dim=0, True)

to fail for both.

I'm updating the PR.

body:
I'll take it back, `x.sort(True)` should fail in any case.
Having `descending` as `kwargs_only: True` in case dim is not provided is the way to go.

This allows the following to be valid on both a Tensor and a Variable:
```
x.sort(0)
x.sort(dim=0)
x.sort(descending=True)
x.sort(dim=0, descending=True)
x.sort(0, descending=True)
x.sort(0,True)
```
and
```
x.sort(True)
x.sort(dim=0, True)
```
to fail for both.

I'm updating the PR.
